name: BEST WESTERN East Zion Thunderbird Lodge

reviews.text: Stayed two nights at the Thunderbird for the location between the national parks. The rooms were nice and clean - dated but clean. There was a small fridge and coffee maker. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We were scheduled to stay 5 days but moved on after two. No real restaurants in the town except the over-priced one @ the hotel and a Subway. We were really looking forward to using the pool and hot tub after hiking and horeback riding. The pool could definately use some work. The hot tub was NASTY! Full of mold and in need of a good scrubbing and some bleach/chlorine. The staff was very pleasant when we checked out and did not give us a hard time. If they fix the pool/hot tub we would probably return. Until then, there are other places that are much better.
reviews.title: Moved on early

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: when checking in we asked if they serve breakfast as most best westerns do. they said yes BUT didn't mention only at their private resturant that is pricey and there is no free BW breakfast at all.
reviews.title: "great location but..........

reviews.text: Laso please note there is no cell reception in the rooms and very weak internet- even their own network.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this motel because of the location for visiting Bryce & Zion national parks. Everything about this place from the rooms to the value was ideal. Our family had connecting rooms in the 1-story building facing the pool and thus no noise from overhead. The hot tub and the quality of the restaurant were added bonuses....don't skip their famous pies. We did hear road noise of trucks passing at night, so you might request rooms farthest from the road as it's a major route.
reviews.title: A great surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the single story building furthest from the main building (which includes a gift shop and restaurant) and it was wonderful. It looks like the unit may have been recently updated. The room had a peaked ceiling, tile floors in the bathroom and sink areas, clean paint, western-style log headboards on the beds, free Wi-Fi and a small refrigerator/freezer (we were glad to have that). It was situated near the motel golf course and was very quiet. The room was quite large and very clean. Service was excellent. We were expecting a typical no frills "boring" motel, but it was not like that at all. The main building decor has a Western flavor including some massive gnarled tree trunks holding up the eaves that add to the ambiance. Staying in Mt. Carmel means a short drive to the east entrance to Zion National Park and another half hour or so if you want to go to the Visitor's Center and the park shuttle. Springdale is closer to that area, but the motels there are more expensive. That's the trade-off if you are only there for Zion.
reviews.title: Location, Location!!! Super clean rooms.

reviews.text: Good night's stay. A little pricey due to location,but you can't ask for a much better jumping off point for Zion (to the East).
reviews.title: Perfect location for the East side of Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious, clean room. Excellent bed and pillows. Small fridge, coffee pot and micro. The usual lineup of cable TV shows. Great location to visit Bryce Canyon and Zion without packing and moving. Got an excellent deal by calling front desk with the "best rate"I could find on line. They beat it.
reviews.title: Nice location for parks

reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel restaurant has convenient late hours. Rooms were nice, and pool and hottub were a plus. Good midway point if you want to visit both canyons. The only negative was no other restaurants within 20 miles.
reviews.title: Good location if you want to visit Bryce and Zion

reviews.text: Large room with lots of space to dump all our junk. Clean with nice view of the grounds and pool. Nice outdoor pool and spa
reviews.title: Thunderbird Mt Carmel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a really good location near the Eastern entrance to Zion National Park. It's no more than 15 minute drive into the canyon itself. The hotel also has a small golf course, gas station, souvenir shop, etc. with friendly and helpful staff. A little on the expensive side, but - well - this is tourist country.
reviews.title: Good Hotel and a Great Diner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spent the day at Zion National Park, this was a great stop-over on our way to Bryce. Clean and neat, nice restaurant with good food, very reasonably priced, we would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Main plus is the strategic location between zion park and bryce canyon. Nice clean rooms behind a gas station. It has also a pool and a golf course (not 18 holes though i believe). Friendly service. Perfect for a stopover or a few nights to visit the parks.
reviews.title: Good hotel, strategic location

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights because the location was great for trips from Zion NP, to Bryce NP, as we passed on to Page. Hotel room was large but very plain decor, Room was clean and comfortable. Single cup coffee maker and larger size mini fridge was nice. Noisy A/C unit. we had second floor with a small balcony that looked out at nothing.
reviews.title: Good Location, Plain but Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a restaurant a small gift shop and convenience stores nearby, coin op laundry room was convenient.
reviews.title: Good place to stay for Zion NP.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly and food in the restaurant was just OK.
reviews.title: Great Room, Close to Zion

reviews.text: Nice hotel/motel. Big, clean rooms, comfy beds and free WIFI.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay close to Bryce and Zion

reviews.text: Decor a little outdated, but we were not looking for trendy. Coffee maker and fridge in room, plus convenience store at the adjacent gas station meant that breakfast at the Thunderbird restaurant was not necessary. We did eat there the evening we arrived ( not much else in the vicinity), and the food was OK. The staff were friendly, but my husband's steak was overcooked. We didn't have room for their famous ho-made pies: the unnecessarily huge portions in the US seemed to rule out desserts for us Europeans in many places.
reviews.title: Good stop between Zion and Bryce national parks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a 9-hole golf course which our room looked onto at the back and a lovely swimming pool + jacuzzi which we could easily see from our private ground-floor balcony, and used a couple of times.
reviews.title: Great stop in a magical location

reviews.text: The hotel also has a kitschy gift shop and a coin-operated guest laundry, very handy for travellers on the road for some time.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel
Clean but dated
reviews.text: All in all, a clean, comfortable, homey and affordable place to stay if you want to see Bryce and/or Zion. I'm so glad we didn't stay in Page, which looked like a real non-place with hugely over-inflated prices.

aka: Best Western East Zion Thunderbird Hotel Mount Carmel
description: Zion National Park lodging at its best! The BEST WESTERN East Zion Thunderbird Lodge offers a refreshing pool, hot tub, great golf fees and free club rentals. Our rooms are 100% smoke free, 100% pet free, with balcony views and patios that overlook the beautiful mountains and lush green golf course, satellite TV. In-room coffee and tea, guest laundry facilities, direct dial in-room phones, free local and 1-800 calls, internet connections, AAA, AARP. We are located 12 miles from the east entrance to Zion National Park, 60 miles from Bryce Canyon National Park, 85 miles from the North Rim of the Grand Canyon, 45 miles from Cedar Breaks National Monument, and 12 miles from the Coral Pink Sand Dunes.
